data.name: The Boring Problem
data.description:
Elon Musk wants to drill a set of tunnels to a number of important locations.  Unfortunately, there are multiple ways he could connect all of these tunnels.  Can you help him find the cheapest way to connect all of the locations?

Locations will be given as a list. `['A','B','C', ...]`

Tunnels will be given as a dictionary.  Each vertice will be a key, and the values will be a list of all of the points that are connected to that vertice.  So, if 'A' and 'B' are connected then the tunnel will be listed under both vertice 'A' and vertice 'B'.  The cost of the tunnel will be the second value.
i.e. `{'A':[('B',10),('C',5)], 'B':[('A',10)], 'C':[('A',5)]}`

Your job is to return the minimum cost to connect all of the locations.

Read More: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prim%27s_algorithm

Note: All graphs will be connected.
